snippet: A lawyer for Gov. Chris Christie’s former campaign manager, Bill Stepien, revealed that federal investigators visited Mr. Stepien’s home in New Jersey and questioned his landlord.
abstract: Court papers filed by a lawyer for Bill Stepien, former campaign manager for New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, indicate that federal prosecutors are moving aggressively to investigate role of the governor’s aides in the George Washington Bridge lane closing scandal; filings reveal that federal investigators have been in direct contact with Stepien, have visited his home and have questioned his landlord.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer for Gov. Chris Christie’s former campaign manager, Bill Stepien, revealed that federal investigators visited Mr. Stepien’s home in New Jersey and questioned his landlord.

headline.main: Federal Prosecutors Looking Closely at Christie Aides, Court Papers Show
headline.print_headline: U.S. Looking Closely at Christie Aides, Papers Show
